intro: Rumfordia penninervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined rumfordia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, palmate leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, arranged in clusters at the leaf axils. It is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
